newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Filter to buy Wheelabrator's EOS unit.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Filter to buy Wheelabrator's EOS unit.

text.p: United States Filter Corp., reporting record third-quarter results, said Monday it has a letter of intent to acquire Wheelabrator EOS Inc. from Wheelabrator Technologies Inc. for about $77.4 million in stock.
U.S. Filter said it also has agreed in principle to a joint marketing deal with the Wheelabrator Bio Gro business whereby the companies will be preferred providers of each other's services.

EOS manages water, wastewater and ground water treatment facilities for both the municipal and industrial water and wastewater industry. It operates about 120 systems under contract and has been active in the municipal privatisation area, owning the wastewater treatment plant at Franklin, Ohio.
U.S. Filter is a leading global provider of water and wastewater treatment equipment, systems and services.
U.S. Filter said it expects the acquisition to boost earnings.

The company, based in Palm Desert, Calif., said its profits jumped 87 percent to $13.1 million, or 22 cents a share, in the quarter ended Dec. 31 from $7.0 million, or 15 cents share, in the year-ago period. Revenues soared 82 percent to $339.6 million from $186.7 million.
U.S. Filter has a worldwide network of 341 sales and service facilities, including 42 manufacturing plants.
U.S. Filter's stock fell $1.875 to $36.50, while Hampton, N.H.-based Wheelabrator rose 12.5 cents to $17 early on the New York Stock Exchange.
